row.entry: This panel provides a powerful functionality in darktable: storing a history stack as a style, and applying it to other images. Styles are created in the darkroom using a button placed below the history panel (see ). They are managed within this lighttable panel, which allows you to apply and delete styles.

sect4.title: create duplicate
sect4.para: When applying a style to selected images, activating this box creates a duplicate of the image before applying the style. Disable this option if you want to try various styles without creating multiple duplicates.

sect4.title: edit
sect4.para: Styles are a collection of history stack items. After pressing edit, you are prompted with a dialogue to include or exclude specific items from the stack. Check option duplicate if you want to create a new style, instead of overwriting the existing one; you need to provide a new style name in this case.

sect4.title: delete
sect4.para: This deletes the selected style, without further question.

sect4.title: import
sect4.para: You can import a style which has been previously saved by darktable. darktable stores styles as XML files with the extension .dtstyle.

sect4.title: export
sect4.para: This option saves a selected style to disk as a .dtstyle file. This allows sharing styles with other users.
